column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make a Personal Organiser
#Text=Staying organized is very important , so read carefully on how to make a personal organizer , which helps you keep up-to-date .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Get an empty book , or staple colourful papers together to make a book .
#Text=It does n't have to be too fancy , though .
#Text=A regular personal organizer is clean , neat and always has a title .
#Text=Make a contents page .
#Text=It looks very mature .
#Text=Make a schedule for the day on the first page .
#Text=Repeat it everyday or make a new one for each day .
#Text=It is your decision .
#Text=Make sure it 's very neat .
#Text=Use rulers if you want to make the schedule in a table or a chart .
#Text=If it includes diagrams or anything complicated , do it in pencil .
#Text=Make a budget with income and expenditure .
#Text=Get a calculator and somehow get it to stay there or you can buy a book that have calculators stapled in them .
#Text=You ca n't glue the calculators , so try stapling them with a sharped-front stapler .
#Text=Keep your school timetable in any of the pages .
#Text=Then you can bring the organizer to school and see which lessons you have next and at what time .
#Text=Make a snack chart .
#Text=It always comes in useful .
#Text=Take a different piece of paper and write down a list of what snack and what time .
#Text=Also write down the time when you have breakfast , lunch and dinner .
#Text=If you want to make diagrams , flow-charts , tables or anything else , then you can .
#Text=It 's best if you make a checklist .
#Text=Make a list of other personal things like , taking a shower , brushing your teeth , doing homework , etc.
#Text=It 's the most important thing to do when you have an organizer .
#Text=Do fun things in an organizer , but do n't make it too fancy and decorated with sequins and beads .
#Text=For example , you can make a special page of " friendship " and glue pictures of your friends and their names underneath .
#Text=Be creative .
#Text=Make as many pages you want and make sure everything is neat .
#Text=If there is a mistake , rub it in white ink if its in pen , if not , then rub it with an eraser .
#Text=Try not to get the organizer too fat .
#Text=If the book is filled up , get another book .
#Text=Staple them together or just have them separate .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Make sure you do n't lose it !
#Text=Make the organizer pages colour-coded .
#Text=You can stick a little paper above the pages and label what the page is about .
#Text=Do n't be afraid to use a ruler for the lines .
#Text=Its better to spend a little more time making it neat then not understanding what you have written before .
#Text=Do n't decorate the book so much .
#Text=An organizer is always neat and clean .
#Text=Avoid getting it wet .
#Text=Follow your organizer ALL the time .
#Text=Keep it as your " pocket-book " which means keeping it in your pocket and taking it everywhere you go .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=When you are writing times , make sure the times are correct .
#Text=If plans change , then do n't rip out the whole page and ruin your book .
#Text=Cross it with white ink and write the new plan .
